noun.description: An anthocyanidin (usually isolated as the chloride, C₁₅H₁₁O₅Cl) of which pelargonin and many other red plant pigments are glycosides.

origin: Early 20th century; earliest use found in Chemical Abstracts. From German Pelargonidin from scientific Latin Pelargon- (in Pelargonium) + German -idin.
